docs.text: there is a scene in patch adams in which patch is in the center of a courtroom , surrounded by people who are giving him a lively standing ovation because of his strong-worded attack on a group of stoic doctors .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: when i noticed that the audience with whom i saw this film was reacting the same way , i realized that i was going to have a hard time finding someone who agrees with me about the quality of the picture .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you see , patch adams revolted me beyond all boundaries .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i hated this movie for every second that i sat watching it , and i actively hate it now , days later , with the simpering , superficial , nauseatingly sentimental images forever plaguing my memories .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i hate every element of the film , beginning with tom shadyac's shameless direction , and all the way up to the misguided and mishandled themes that the screenplay wants so desperately to convey .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the badness of patch adams is stupefying .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it's confounding .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i can't believe a film can be this bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and yet , it's based on a real man who probably has a good point to make .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the film , patch is played by the undefeatable and indefatigable robin williams , in a performance of such insulting pathos and sledgehammer sympathy that i wonder now if he is even human .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the beginning of the film , patch commits himself to a mental institution because he doesn't want to kill himself .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: while there , he notices that the doctors don't care about the patients , and that the best way to get through to the patients is to treat them like human beings .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so , patch goes on a crusade to be a great doctor who actually talks to his patients .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he goes to medical school , where he meets truman ( daniel london ) and convinces him that it's good to help people .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he also meets carin fischer ( monica potters ) , the anti-male med student who just wants to go through the motions and be a successful doctor .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: naturally , the dean of the medical school ( bob gunton ) hates patch , and wants to thwart his plans , even though patch gets the highest scores on all of his exams .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: so patch decides that he's going to build a free clinic in the middle of nowhere to help people with any problem they may have .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and that , my friends , is the synopsis for what is easily the most abhorrent picture of 1998 .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: on a superficial level , the film is not particularly bad : i wouldn't say the cinematography bothered me , and most of the performances seem to be exactly what shadyac was aiming for ( i actually liked potter's performance , even if she is wasted ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the film fails fundamentally in execution .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: every scene swells with grand , " emotional " music , played at maximum volume just to get us all to cry real hard .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: take , for instance , the first scene , which shows patch sitting on a bus .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we don't know patch yet , but there's sad music , and it's supposed to make us really sad that he's sad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: later on , patch makes a lot of progress : he helps a dying patient ( peter coyote ) to enjoy the last days of his life , and the music as patch is pushing the patient recklessly through the halls of the hospital is very lively .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and when that patient finally dies ( spoiler alert ! ) , the music is very very sad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but the problem with all of this is that the music should not be the center of the emotions .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: real drama is character-based .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you grow to like someone , and then something bad happens , and you feel it .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: we don't ever grow to know the dying patient ; he's simply a vehicle for patch's greatness .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: real drama doesn't seem forced , or present just to make the audience cry .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that's why patch adams is not real drama .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it goes for every cheap tear imaginable , wringing tired and overbearing sentimentality out of every scene .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: even scenes that have very little impact on the overall film are drowning in marc shaiman's sickening musical score .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: sentimentality like this is indeed bad .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but it's not as bad as half-baked , simplistic themes .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you see , patch is a really great student .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he aces his tests without studying , and does it so effectively that people think he's cheating .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but patch doesn't think that memorizing facts is the way to become a good doctor .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " why don't we see patients until the third year ? " he bursts out every three seconds .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: well , patch , that might have something to do with the fact that you need to learn something before you go treating patients .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: not everyone has the capability of memorizing facts with no effort .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: most of us have to study .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and a doctor who really wants to help , but doesn't know a toe from a finger , probably won't be too successful in preventing death .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: oh wait , i almost forgot : the point of doctors is not just to " prevent death , " but to " improve the quality of life ! "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: yes !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: that is true !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and you can not do that without studying .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: you can not do that without going to medical school .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: what patch never seemed to understand was the possibility that maybe , just maybe , it is a good idea to study first and talk to patients later .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: follow the rules ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: bah !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: who needs the rules !
docs.label: negative

docs.text: only uptight doctors follow the rules .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the real saviors are the ones running around the hospitals with big red spheres on their faces and sporting baggy yellow pants .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and then there's the free clinic issue , which i find shockingly , frighteningly idealistic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: a free clinic .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the middle of the forest .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: where patients can be taken to be helped .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: for free .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: how will patients be transported to the free clinic ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: will it have an emergency room ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: or is it just for mental patients ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and who , may i ask , will pay for it ?
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the film does give some token attempts to question patch's motives ( i think another character asks him how he's going to pay for it , in addition to a little bit of meaningless blather about hmos and medical insurance ) , but they certainly don't explore or challenge patch's ideas to any meaningful extent .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: reader , please understand this : i am not making any kind of judgment on the real patch adams .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i know nothing about him .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: if his beliefs mirror those of this film character , then i might like to have an intelligent discussion with him about them .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: but regardless of what the real patch adams believes , the themes put forth in this film are simplistic and phony .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: and in the last scene , the big , obligatory courtroom scene that forced my lunch halfway up my esophagus , patch does a lot of shouting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: actually , robin williams does a lot of shouting .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: he shouts a lot about helping people , and a lot of people cry because they are moved by his words .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i won't tell you that you can't be moved by his words , because i , too , was moved by his words .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: i was moved in such a profoundly negative way that i was reminded of how cheap and phony a cinematic experience can be .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: patch adams is the cheapest of them all .
docs.label: negative
